macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Futures Rise Ahead of Holiday-Shortened Week
items.summary: Major US index futures posted gains as markets prepare for a shortened trading week due to Christmas. Nasdaq 100 futures gained 0.34%, while Dow Jones and S&P 500 futures strengthened by 0.15% and 0.21% respectively, with the tech sector leading the recovery.

items.title: Tech Sector Rebounds with Oracle and NVIDIA Leading Gains
items.summary: Oracle Corporation shares jumped following a deal to manage TikTok's US operations through a new joint venture, while NVIDIA rebounded on potential export permits for AI chips to China, signaling continued momentum in the AI sector.

items.title: NASDAQ Closes at 23,307 with Strong Weekly Performance
items.summary: The NASDAQ rose 301 points to close at 23,307 with 58% of stocks on the index rising and volume at 13.4 billion shares, posting a weekly gain of 112 points.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Whale Opens $120M Short Positions on BTC and ETH
items.summary: A major crypto whale expanded leveraged short positions totaling around $120M on Bitcoin and Ethereum, selling 255 BTC and signaling bearish sentiment amid market struggles. Analysts note ongoing selling pressure near key support levels.

items.title: Bitcoin Rises to $89,000 as Gold Tokens Shine in Crypto Markets
items.summary: Bitcoin climbed to $89,000, steadying near this level, while gold-backed tokens outperformed amid rising gold prices and gains in Asia stocks. Ether and other majors like SOL and ADA also featured in market updates.

items.title: Top DOJ Official Todd Blanche Halted Crypto Enforcement While Holding $150K+ in Assets
items.summary: DOJ's second-highest official shut down crypto enforcement actions despite holding over $150,000 in Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, and Coinbase stock, raising conflict-of-interest concerns. This aligns with pro-crypto shifts under Trump administration.

items.title: $27 Billion in Bitcoin and Ether Options Face Year-End Reset
items.summary: A massive $27 billion in Bitcoin and Ether options is set for a Boxing Day year-end reset, potentially impacting market volatility as positions expire.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: AI Fuels Record Layoffs in 2025 as Major Tech Companies Cut Costs
items.summary: Over 122,549 tech employees have been laid off across 257 companies in 2025, with more than 54,000 US job cuts directly attributed to AI. Microsoft has conducted around 15,000 layoffs this year, making AI adoption a core performance metric for all roles.

items.title: New AI Framework Discovers Simple Rules in Complex Systems
items.summary: Researchers published a breakthrough method in npj Complexity that uses AI to reduce complex nonlinear systems with hundreds of variables into simpler models with far fewer dimensions, producing models more than 10 times smaller than previous approaches while maintaining accuracy.

items.title: AI Goes Mainstream in Food and Beverage Industry
items.summary: AI tools including trend-spotting engines and autonomous R&D agents have become everyday infrastructure in food and beverage companies. Startups like Starday and Turing Labs are using AI for predictive analytics and product development automation.

items.title: AI Applications Transforming Commercial Vehicles Industry
items.summary: AI is revolutionizing fleet efficiency through work order automation, prognostics for predictive maintenance, emotional intelligence for vehicle safety, and autonomous driving technology that reduces human intervention and boosts operational efficiency.

items.title: Business Leaders Discuss AI Workforce Transformation and Rapid Model Competition
items.summary: Industry experts emphasize that AI will reshape rather than eliminate jobs, with seven major AI models launching within a month during the second half of 2025, signaling intense competition and rapidly expanding capabilities.

items.title: Telecommunications and Vendor Headcount Declines Attributed to AI
items.summary: Thousands of jobs have disappeared from telco and vendor workforces in 2025 as company leadership blamed AI for workforce reductions.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
